KH.content: there is no tale of her [khōra], a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet
KH.linkedContent: there is no tale of her [khōra], a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet

GOD.content: demonic (esoteric, secret, sacred, lines blurred btwn human & animal) vs. responsibility [Nietzsche’s ressentiment?]
GOD.linkedContent: demonic (esoteric, secret, sacred, lines blurred btwn human & animal) vs. responsibility [Nietzsche’s ressentiment?]

GOD.content: via Patočka, 2 heterogenous secrets: 1) secret of historicity 2) secret of orgiastic mystery which history of responsibility has to break w/
GOD.linkedContent: via Patočka, 2 heterogenous secrets: 1) secret of historicity 2) secret of orgiastic mystery which history of responsibility has to break w/

GOD.content: [another secret] Christian mysterium tremendum, fear and trembling before sacrificial gift, person being paralyzed, in its singularity, by the gaze of God
GOD.linkedContent: [another secret] Christian mysterium tremendum, fear and trembling before sacrificial gift, person being paralyzed, in its singularity, by the gaze of God

GOD.content: via Patočka, history of responsible, built on heritage and patrimony of secrecy, begins w/ Plato’s break from orgiastic mystery, continues w/ Christianity’s mysterium tremendum > a tremor in figures of death as figures of gift, or as gifts of death
GOD.linkedContent: via Patočka, history of responsible, built on heritage and patrimony of secrecy, begins w/ Plato’s break from orgiastic mystery, continues w/ Christianity’s mysterium tremendum > a tremor in figures of death as figures of gift, or as gifts of death

GOD.content: anabasis, or “conversion,” the turns in the history of secrecy, history of revolutions, history as revolution
GOD.linkedContent: anabasis, or “conversion,” the turns in the history of secrecy, history of revolutions, history as revolution

GOD.content: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?
GOD.linkedContent: [economy of the sacrifice] in turn toward new mystery, toward new structure of responsibility, prior one never eliminated, kept w/in oneself, mourned as crypt of a more ancient secret > is this repression, is this a kind of sacrificial Aufhebung?

GOD.content: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy
GOD.linkedContent: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy

GOD.content: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē
GOD.linkedContent: Derrida starts w/ Phaedo, w/ meletē tou thanatou, w/ Socrates’ play on aïdēs (“one who doesn’t see”) & haidēs, references Levinas, Heidegger, then: care about dying as relation to self, mystery or secrecy in formation of psychē

GOD.content: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]
GOD.linkedContent: philosophy from the start, vigil (veille) over death that watches out for death and watches over death (qui veille à la mort et sur elle), as if over the very life of the soul, psychē as life, breath, pneuma, caring anticipation of dying, provisional mourning, vigil as veillée and wake [in English]

GOD.content: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)
GOD.linkedContent: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)

GOD.content: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]
GOD.linkedContent: [secretum as history of truth, as cryptology, as a subjectification, separation from community of fusion]

GOD.content: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy
GOD.linkedContent: genealogy’s axiom: history never effaces what it buries (enfouit), keeps (garde) secret of what it encrypts, the secret of the secret, c’est une histoire secrète du secret gardé; genealogy is also an economy

GOD.content: responsibility, aporia btwn choice and heresy (hairesis as choice, election), a type of secrecy that keeps responsibility apart (tient la responsabilitié à l’écart) and in secret, the very thing responsibility insists on
GOD.linkedContent: responsibility, aporia btwn choice and heresy (hairesis as choice, election), a type of secrecy that keeps responsibility apart (tient la responsabilitié à l’écart) and in secret, the very thing responsibility insists on

GOD.content: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret
GOD.linkedContent: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret

GOD.content: another secret, another seal (supplementary seal), comes to overlay (sceller) the unlivable experience, another concealment (cèlement) to the tremor > afraid of the fear, tremble in form of not knowing: a double secret
GOD.linkedContent: another secret, another seal (supplementary seal), comes to overlay (sceller) the unlivable experience, another concealment (cèlement) to the tremor > afraid of the fear, tremble in form of not knowing: a double secret

GOD.content: by keeping the secret, Abraham betrays [generalized] ethics
GOD.linkedContent: by keeping the secret, Abraham betrays [generalized] ethics

GOD.content: for Hegel, manifestation, unveiling, phenomenalization is given priority over secret: no final secret for philosophy, politics, ethics
GOD.linkedContent: for Hegel, manifestation, unveiling, phenomenalization is given priority over secret: no final secret for philosophy, politics, ethics

GOD.content: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives
GOD.linkedContent: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives

GOD.content: can only respond to the one, to the other, by sacrificing the one to the other > will never be able to justify this sacrifice, will always be held in secret
GOD.linkedContent: can only respond to the one, to the other, by sacrificing the one to the other > will never be able to justify this sacrifice, will always be held in secret

GOD.content: a decision is always secret, always secret in instant of its performance; Abraham’s decision is absolutely responsible: answers for itself before the absolute other
GOD.linkedContent: a decision is always secret, always secret in instant of its performance; Abraham’s decision is absolutely responsible: answers for itself before the absolute other

GOD.content: can a secret be transmitted? (yes & no); we do not understand, w/ Kierkegaard, Abraham’s decision; we share w/ Abraham what can’t be shared [highest passion, faith], a secret we know nothing about, neither him nor us > an incessant repetition of the absolute beginning
GOD.linkedContent: can a secret be transmitted? (yes & no); we do not understand, w/ Kierkegaard, Abraham’s decision; we share w/ Abraham what can’t be shared [highest passion, faith], a secret we know nothing about, neither him nor us > an incessant repetition of the absolute beginning

GOD.content: the speculative requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret [re: tout autre est tout autre]
GOD.linkedContent: the speculative requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret [re: tout autre est tout autre]

GOD.content: the invisible (1: visible invisible 2: absolute invisible) vs. the secret
GOD.linkedContent: the invisible (1: visible invisible 2: absolute invisible) vs. the secret

GOD.content: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)
GOD.linkedContent: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)

GOD.content: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre ——Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito
GOD.linkedContent: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre ——Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito

GOD.content: Christianity, “seeing in secret,” God the Father restores economy interrupted by the dividing of heaven from earth
GOD.linkedContent: Christianity, “seeing in secret,” God the Father restores economy interrupted by the dividing of heaven from earth

GOD.content: the 2 economies: 1) calculation, Judaic 2) dissymetric economy of sacrifice, “beyond the totality of the calculable as a finite totality of the same,” renunciation of merchandise, still relies on giving back (rendre), on yield, profit, but only father who sees in secret [can calculate]
GOD.linkedContent: the 2 economies: 1) calculation, Judaic 2) dissymetric economy of sacrifice, “beyond the totality of the calculable as a finite totality of the same,” renunciation of merchandise, still relies on giving back (rendre), on yield, profit, but only father who sees in secret [can calculate]

GOD.content: God as the name of the possibility of keeping a secret that is visible from the interior but not from the exterior, a witness others cannot see, other than me, more intimate with me than myself, structure of invisible interiority, God calls me, I call myself God
GOD.linkedContent: God as the name of the possibility of keeping a secret that is visible from the interior but not from the exterior, a witness others cannot see, other than me, more intimate with me than myself, structure of invisible interiority, God calls me, I call myself God

GOD.content: secret market of secrecy, “Christianity’s stroke of genius,” says Nietzsche, merchandise, give credit to the infinite [denounce all calculation & still yield surplus-value]
GOD.linkedContent: secret market of secrecy, “Christianity’s stroke of genius,” says Nietzsche, merchandise, give credit to the infinite [denounce all calculation & still yield surplus-value]

GOD.content: re: test God imposed on Abraham, where, all the way to hyperbole, “not meaning to say (de ne pas vouloir dire)” (keeping a secret) = not being able to mean (to say) (ne pas pouvoir vouloir dire)
GOD.linkedContent: re: test God imposed on Abraham, where, all the way to hyperbole, “not meaning to say (de ne pas vouloir dire)” (keeping a secret) = not being able to mean (to say) (ne pas pouvoir vouloir dire)

GOD.content: secret of secrecy, not a hiding something, as in not revealing the truth, but respecting absolute singularity, infinite separation of what binds me to the unique, to one as to the other, à l’Un comme à l’Autre)
GOD.linkedContent: secret of secrecy, not a hiding something, as in not revealing the truth, but respecting absolute singularity, infinite separation of what binds me to the unique, to one as to the other, à l’Un comme à l’Autre)

GOD.content: via Kierkegaard, generality of ethics is bloodless specter of faith; teleological suspension of ethics determined by Abraham’s silence; aesthetics cultivates secret, ethics punishes it
GOD.linkedContent: via Kierkegaard, generality of ethics is bloodless specter of faith; teleological suspension of ethics determined by Abraham’s silence; aesthetics cultivates secret, ethics punishes it

GOD.content: instead of asking forgiveness for misdeed, I ask forgiveness for preferring you to the other other—unforgivable in forgiveness; Abraham prefers secret that binds him to God than secret that binds him to the other other [Isaac, family]
GOD.linkedContent: instead of asking forgiveness for misdeed, I ask forgiveness for preferring you to the other other—unforgivable in forgiveness; Abraham prefers secret that binds him to God than secret that binds him to the other other [Isaac, family]

GOD.content: Abraham’s silence, secrecy of unforgivable, decision, would have “to be forgiven by the one he obeyed”
GOD.linkedContent: Abraham’s silence, secrecy of unforgivable, decision, would have “to be forgiven by the one he obeyed”

GOD.content: double secret: 1) God’s call to make the greatest sacrifice 2) reason or sense of the demand for the sacrifice
GOD.linkedContent: double secret: 1) God’s call to make the greatest sacrifice 2) reason or sense of the demand for the sacrifice

GOD.content: Abraham held to secrecy because the secret remains secret from him
GOD.linkedContent: Abraham held to secrecy because the secret remains secret from him

GOD.content: “pardon for not meaning (to say),” secretless secret of literature, scene of forgiveness, its being “up in the air” keeps it secret, announces literature
GOD.linkedContent: “pardon for not meaning (to say),” secretless secret of literature, scene of forgiveness, its being “up in the air” keeps it secret, announces literature

GOD.content: absolute secrecy,  a secret to keep as a shared inheritance of a secret that can’t be shared, absolute dissymmetry
GOD.linkedContent: absolute secrecy, a secret to keep as a shared inheritance of a secret that can’t be shared, absolute dissymmetry

GOD.content: secret secret of forgiveness: to remain secret, and to become self-forgiveness (via specular identification), and in the ambiguity of se pardonner, to be deprived of sense in this narcissistic reflexivity
GOD.linkedContent: secret secret of forgiveness: to remain secret, and to become self-forgiveness (via specular identification), and in the ambiguity of se pardonner, to be deprived of sense in this narcissistic reflexivity

GOD.content: to ask forgiveness is to identify with the other, auto-affect, hetero-affect
GOD.linkedContent: to ask forgiveness is to identify with the other, auto-affect, hetero-affect

GT.content: perhaps, mode of gift, (atopic, utopic) madness of desire to give the impossible, this madness would also be a forgetting, to forget the gift [secret of death]
GT.linkedContent: perhaps, mode of gift, (atopic, utopic) madness of desire to give the impossible, this madness would also be a forgetting, to forget the gift [secret of death]

GT.content: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret
GT.linkedContent: reader is not deceived [like narrator], experiences a secret w/out depth, a secret w/out secret

GT.content: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle
GT.linkedContent: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle

GT.content: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent
GT.linkedContent: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent

GT.content: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend
GT.linkedContent: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend

GT.content: literature as place of non-place of frame, triptych w/ dislocated frame, 3 + or – excluded 4th, all positions exchangeable to infinity, an ex-propriation that forbids a return to self, most powerful or interesting speculation
GT.linkedContent: literature as place of non-place of frame, triptych w/ dislocated frame, 3 + or – excluded 4th, all positions exchangeable to infinity, an ex-propriation that forbids a return to self, most powerful or interesting speculation

GT.content: readers are at once debtors & creditors, like the narrator, we are the beggar, the 3rd party excluded from the secret of the dual scene
GT.linkedContent: readers are at once debtors & creditors, like the narrator, we are the beggar, the 3rd party excluded from the secret of the dual scene

GT.content: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable
GT.linkedContent: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable

GT.content: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)
GT.linkedContent: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)

GT.content: literature desacralizes the world like Abraham’s sacrifice [in the name of a secret w/out content]
GT.linkedContent: literature desacralizes the world like Abraham’s sacrifice [in the name of a secret w/out content]

GT.content: infinite secret btwn the 2 [re: “Counterfeit Money”], opening space of absolute heterogeneity, beyond everything they have said to each other, the reason they’ve given each other
GT.linkedContent: infinite secret btwn the 2 [re: “Counterfeit Money”], opening space of absolute heterogeneity, beyond everything they have said to each other, the reason they’ve given each other

GT.content: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit”  [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]
GT.linkedContent: secret of literature has no depth, no interiority, spread on the surface of the page, non-psychological structure, not subjective though responsible for most radical effects of subjectivity, a post card, a bank note, a “letter of credit” [see LOBL p. ~101, & SUBJECTILE]

MONL.content: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)
MONL.linkedContent: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)

MONL.content: “incarnate archive of a liturgy whose secret no one will betray,” no one else could appropriate, even I, who is in on the secret
MONL.linkedContent: “incarnate archive of a liturgy whose secret no one will betray,” no one else could appropriate, even I, who is in on the secret

MONL.content: there are 2 others: 1) language of the other as promised sentence 2) language of other as that of master or colonist; both have unsettling resemblances kept secret, held in reserve
MONL.linkedContent: there are 2 others: 1) language of the other as promised sentence 2) language of other as that of master or colonist; both have unsettling resemblances kept secret, held in reserve

R.content: democracy must be public, phenomenal, something of the Enlightenment, but also it must give rights to the secret, society of the secret (voyoucracy)
R.linkedContent: democracy must be public, phenomenal, something of the Enlightenment, but also it must give rights to the secret, society of the secret (voyoucracy)

R.content: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer
R.linkedContent: voyoucracy, corrupting power of street, not anarchic disorder, but structured disorder, secret society, seducer

R.content: [quoted in KH] democratic double injunction (around edges of khōra): 1) all-inclusive 2) secret entrusted to those worthy of it > paradox of example, good example
R.linkedContent: [quoted in KH] democratic double injunction (around edges of khōra): 1) all-inclusive 2) secret entrusted to those worthy of it > paradox of example, good example

R.content: justice w/ disjointure: out of joint, interruption of relation, unbinding > infinite secret of the other, threatens a communitarian idea of justice [See SPOM p. 30 joining is a thinking of injunction] [heterogeneous inseparability of law & justice developed in FL, then SPOM in discussion w Heidegger's dikē (gathering, harmony, adjoining)]
R.linkedContent: justice w/ disjointure: out of joint, interruption of relation, unbinding > infinite secret of the other, threatens a communitarian idea of justice [See SPOM p. 30 joining is a thinking of injunction] [heterogeneous inseparability of law & justice developed in FL, then SPOM in discussion w Heidegger's dikē (gathering, harmony, adjoining)]

R.content: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives
R.linkedContent: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives

FK.content: desert of the desert [outside set] [see SPOM p. 33]
FK.linkedContent: desert of the desert [outside set] [see SPOM p. 33]

FK.content: khōra, secret, desert of the desert (last desert, before the first), neither a threshold nor a mourning, btwn event and possibility, or virtuality of the event, not the desert of revelation
FK.linkedContent: khōra, secret, desert of the desert (last desert, before the first), neither a threshold nor a mourning, btwn event and possibility, or virtuality of the event, not the desert of revelation

FK.content: Derrida thinks Justice in relation to a sundering (déliaison), an always-safe, always-to-be-saved possibility of secret of disassociation, rather than bringing-together (Versammlung) re: dikē
FK.linkedContent: Derrida thinks Justice in relation to a sundering (déliaison), an always-safe, always-to-be-saved possibility of secret of disassociation, rather than bringing-together (Versammlung) re: dikē

FK.content: the secret: reticence btwn two experiences of religion (btwn credit & unscathed) [see p. 70] pp. 85-86 holding-back, restraint (halte), inhibition, modesty: universal structure of religiosity, mystical immunity of the secret > not w/out intuitive violence, to that which remains unscathed
FK.linkedContent: the secret: reticence btwn two experiences of religion (btwn credit & unscathed) [see p. 70] pp. 85-86 holding-back, restraint (halte), inhibition, modesty: universal structure of religiosity, mystical immunity of the secret > not w/out intuitive violence, to that which remains unscathed

FK.content: socius as the secret of testimonial experience, a certain faith, address/relation to tout autre, that is, socius as non-relationship of absolute interruption: Levinas, Blanchot
FK.linkedContent: socius as the secret of testimonial experience, a certain faith, address/relation to tout autre, that is, socius as non-relationship of absolute interruption: Levinas, Blanchot

H.content: “no fixed address” of death, no phenomenal exteriority, interiority of the heart, nocturnal secret (a suffering both intimate & infinite)
H.linkedContent: “no fixed address” of death, no phenomenal exteriority, interiority of the heart, nocturnal secret (a suffering both intimate & infinite)

AF.content: [re: Yerushalmi] monolinguist who says “we” promises secrecy for a virtual response [re: Freud’s unknown conviction that psychoanalysis was a Jewish science], does Freud’s ghost murmur the secret in private [to Yerushalmi]?
AF.linkedContent: [re: Yerushalmi] monolinguist who says “we” promises secrecy for a virtual response [re: Freud’s unknown conviction that psychoanalysis was a Jewish science], does Freud’s ghost murmur the secret in private [to Yerushalmi]?

AF.content: Yerushalmi would like be the first after Freud, alone in sharing a secret, an inheritor in lineage of arch-patriarchs [re: knowing Freud knew psychoanalysis was a Jewish science]
AF.linkedContent: Yerushalmi would like be the first after Freud, alone in sharing a secret, an inheritor in lineage of arch-patriarchs [re: knowing Freud knew psychoanalysis was a Jewish science]

AF.content: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location
AF.linkedContent: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location

AF.content: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive (speculation begins there, belief too)
AF.linkedContent: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive (speculation begins there, belief too)

AF.content: [what did Freud keep of his] unconditional right to secrecy
AF.linkedContent: [what did Freud keep of his] unconditional right to secrecy

LOBL.content: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”
LOBL.linkedContent: “the initial [re: J.] keeps (garde) the secret like a grave—jealously”

LOBL.content: Derrida did not keep his promise to consider translatability [see p. ~89], but keeps a secret
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida did not keep his promise to consider translatability [see p. ~89], but keeps a secret

SPOM.content: one always inherits around a secret
SPOM.linkedContent: one always inherits around a secret

SPOM.content: one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime of its very author
SPOM.linkedContent: one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime of its very author

SPOM.content: the table, wood table, armed head to toe: origin of exchange-value, birth of capital, of mysticism and the secret [?]
SPOM.linkedContent: the table, wood table, armed head to toe: origin of exchange-value, birth of capital, of mysticism and the secret [?]

SPOM.content: the secret (Geheimnis) of the fetishism of the commodity, the “germ” of the money-form, une table tournante, example of an apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: the secret (Geheimnis) of the fetishism of the commodity, the “germ” of the money-form, une table tournante, example of an apparition

SPOM.content: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds
SPOM.linkedContent: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds

SPOM.content: the 2 experiences of the secret: I tell you that I cannot tell you > my 1st crime and 1st confession, a confession w/out confession
SPOM.linkedContent: the 2 experiences of the secret: I tell you that I cannot tell you > my 1st crime and 1st confession, a confession w/out confession

SPOM.content: Heidegger’s Being as near to the secret [fixerup—missing source]
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Being as near to the secret [fixerup—missing source]

POO.content: il y a là du secret [see CIN p. 13 il y la (là) cendres] > “let us [deconstructionists?] testify (témoignons) to a secret that is without content, without a content separable from its performative experience, from its performative tracing”
POO.linkedContent: il y a là du secret [see CIN p. 13 il y la (là) cendres] > “let us [deconstructionists?] testify (témoignons) to a secret that is without content, without a content separable from its performative experience, from its performative tracing”

POO.content: not genius
POO.linkedContent: not genius

POO.content: not a conscious misrepresentation, nor knowing an unconscious representation
POO.linkedContent: not a conscious misrepresentation, nor knowing an unconscious representation

POO.content: not phenomenalizable
POO.linkedContent: not phenomenalizable

POO.content: secret remains a mystery of passion
POO.linkedContent: secret remains a mystery of passion

POO.content: secret is not mystical
POO.linkedContent: secret is not mystical

POO.content: does not belong to truth as homoiosis (adequation), nor to truth as memory (Mnemosyne, alētheia)
POO.linkedContent: does not belong to truth as homoiosis (adequation), nor to truth as memory (Mnemosyne, alētheia)

POO.content: it is not the secret as the near, the intimate, the proper
POO.linkedContent: it is not the secret as the near, the intimate, the proper

POO.content: happens at every instant, is irreducible to the name which makes it secret, even when one makes the truth [Augustine] in its name (fait la verité à son sujet)
POO.linkedContent: happens at every instant, is irreducible to the name which makes it secret, even when one makes the truth [Augustine] in its name (fait la verité à son sujet)

POO.content: possibility of homonymy and mimesis
POO.linkedContent: possibility of homonymy and mimesis

POO.content: absolute nonresponse, can’t call to account, can’t grant indemnity
POO.linkedContent: absolute nonresponse, can’t call to account, can’t grant indemnity

POO.content: “so many ruses, always, to draw it [the secret] into a process…but it never surrenders to it [a process]”
POO.linkedContent: “so many ruses, always, to draw it [the secret] into a process…but it never surrenders to it [a process]”

POO.content: the secret can never be reduced even when ethics try, one cannot help but respect it
POO.linkedContent: the secret can never be reduced even when ethics try, one cannot help but respect it

POO.content: taste for secret histories, secret like khōra, outside all periodization, all epochalization
POO.linkedContent: taste for secret histories, secret like khōra, outside all periodization, all epochalization

POO.content: Derrida does not like literature for its own sake, for some pleasure, or aesthetic, but for the secret, the passion of the secret, the secret of the passion > in place of the secret only remainder remains, not even literature
POO.linkedContent: Derrida does not like literature for its own sake, for some pleasure, or aesthetic, but for the secret, the passion of the secret, the secret of the passion > in place of the secret only remainder remains, not even literature

POO.content: literature: right to say everything, w/out ever touching the secret
POO.linkedContent: literature: right to say everything, w/out ever touching the secret

POO.content: call of secret impassions us
POO.linkedContent: call of secret impassions us

POO.content: calculable democratic subject must reveal secret
POO.linkedContent: calculable democratic subject must reveal secret

POO.content: one can lie, cheat, seduce by making use of the secret, one can use it to gain authority
POO.linkedContent: one can lie, cheat, seduce by making use of the secret, one can use it to gain authority

POO.content: the simulacrum bears witness to the secret as solitude [see pp. 131-32n au secret (in the secret, isolated)]
POO.linkedContent: the simulacrum bears witness to the secret as solitude [see pp. 131-32n au secret (in the secret, isolated)]

POO.content: even if the secret makes social bonds possible it does not answer to them
POO.linkedContent: even if the secret makes social bonds possible it does not answer to them

POO.content: Poe [Purloined Letter] tells the secret twice, w/out same secret being penetrated, matter of trace, secret can be announced w/out being revealed or secret is manifest but still in need of translation
POO.linkedContent: Poe [Purloined Letter] tells the secret twice, w/out same secret being penetrated, matter of trace, secret can be announced w/out being revealed or secret is manifest but still in need of translation

POO.content: distinction btwn “mention” & “use” still pragmatic, difference must not be thematized is the secret
POO.linkedContent: distinction btwn “mention” & “use” still pragmatic, difference must not be thematized is the secret

BL.content: the inaccessible incites from its place of hiding
BL.linkedContent: the inaccessible incites from its place of hiding

HASD.content: [blurring lines btwn conscious/unconscious, man/animal] if animals can’t keep secrets, because they can’t represent as such, secret linked to Vorstellung, linked to lying, not presenting in speech that which one has an articulated representation, keep to oneself
HASD.linkedContent: [blurring lines btwn conscious/unconscious, man/animal] if animals can’t keep secrets, because they can’t represent as such, secret linked to Vorstellung, linked to lying, not presenting in speech that which one has an articulated representation, keep to oneself

HASD.content: garder pour soi, voilà le pouvoir le plus incroyable et qui donne le plus à penser > must there not be dissimulation, multiplicity & difference from oneself, trace, for there to be keeping?
HASD.linkedContent: garder pour soi, voilà le pouvoir le plus incroyable et qui donne le plus à penser > must there not be dissimulation, multiplicity & difference from oneself, trace, for there to be keeping?

HASD.content: can one ever say for certain: the secret has been kept?
HASD.linkedContent: can one ever say for certain: the secret has been kept?

HASD.content: homology btwn secret group (topography of social link) and the place of the secret (beyond all position)
HASD.linkedContent: homology btwn secret group (topography of social link) and the place of the secret (beyond all position)

HASD.content: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]
HASD.linkedContent: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]

HASD.content: since promise is also an order, allegorical veil becomes political shield, solid barrier of a social division, a shibboleth
HASD.linkedContent: since promise is also an order, allegorical veil becomes political shield, solid barrier of a social division, a shibboleth

HASD.content: Dionysius’ 2 modes [esoteric/exoteric] of transmission: 1) unspeakable, prohibited, inaccessible (aporreton) secret, “symbolic and initiatory” 2) philosophic, demonstrative (apodeiktiken), capable of being shown
HASD.linkedContent: Dionysius’ 2 modes [esoteric/exoteric] of transmission: 1) unspeakable, prohibited, inaccessible (aporreton) secret, “symbolic and initiatory” 2) philosophic, demonstrative (apodeiktiken), capable of being shown

HASD.content: doesn’t discourse of Dionysius & Derrida keep to place where these 2 modes cross? such place cannot be an indivisible point > 2 languages bear the silence of the other, secret must and must not allow itself to be divulged
HASD.linkedContent: doesn’t discourse of Dionysius & Derrida keep to place where these 2 modes cross? such place cannot be an indivisible point > 2 languages bear the silence of the other, secret must and must not allow itself to be divulged

HASD.content: a dénégation prior to Freudian context, secret of denial, a negativity that de-negates itself, gives no chance to dialectic
HASD.linkedContent: a dénégation prior to Freudian context, secret of denial, a negativity that de-negates itself, gives no chance to dialectic

HASD.content: there is no secret as such, I deny it, this is what I confide in secret to whoever allies himself to me, this is the secret of alliance
HASD.linkedContent: there is no secret as such, I deny it, this is what I confide in secret to whoever allies himself to me, this is the secret of alliance

MPM.content: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else
MPM.linkedContent: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else

MSUBJ.content: subjectile’s secret should only be shared w/ the translator: that it is untranslatable
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile’s secret should only be shared w/ the translator: that it is untranslatable

A.content: death always the name of a secret, signs irreplaceable singularity, puts forth common name of the proper name w/out name, always a shibboleth > language about death long history of a secret society, hidden religion of the awaiting, a universal Marrano
A.linkedContent: death always the name of a secret, signs irreplaceable singularity, puts forth common name of the proper name w/out name, always a shibboleth > language about death long history of a secret society, hidden religion of the awaiting, a universal Marrano

A.content: that which lives w/ out a name, we’ll give an added name (surnom) [which a name always is]: Marrano (crypto-judaic, crypto-X), believe if you want to the Marranos have come to an end
A.linkedContent: that which lives w/ out a name, we’ll give an added name (surnom) [which a name always is]: Marrano (crypto-judaic, crypto-X), believe if you want to the Marranos have come to an end

A.content: Marranos that we are, whether we know it or not, incessantly older & younger, untimely histories, still waiting for the other in a last word infinitely finished
A.linkedContent: Marranos that we are, whether we know it or not, incessantly older & younger, untimely histories, still waiting for the other in a last word infinitely finished

A.content: Marrano: anyone who remains faithful to a secret he hasn’t chosen
A.linkedContent: Marrano: anyone who remains faithful to a secret he hasn’t chosen

A.content: Kant assigns place of secret in practice of politics to philosophers in his vision of perpetual peace
A.linkedContent: Kant assigns place of secret in practice of politics to philosophers in his vision of perpetual peace

SEC.content: no code of writing is structurally secret, can always be iterable for a 3<sup><small>rd</small></sup> party
SEC.linkedContent: no code of writing is structurally secret, can always be iterable for a 3rd party

PP.content: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present
PP.linkedContent: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present

VM.content: for Levinas, w/out primordial secret, w/out relationship to other in solitude, parricide is philosophy’s theatrical fiction
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, w/out primordial secret, w/out relationship to other in solitude, parricide is philosophy’s theatrical fiction

VM.content: Husserl’s alter-ego, nonviolent respect of secret, of separation, we can only know the other through analogical appresentation > translates recognition of radical separation
VM.linkedContent: Husserl’s alter-ego, nonviolent respect of secret, of separation, we can only know the other through analogical appresentation > translates recognition of radical separation

PAS.content: Blanchot: “more secret and more interior than speech of the innermost heart” > “the secret is w/out depth (sans profondeur)”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: “more secret and more interior than speech of the innermost heart” > “the secret is w/out depth (sans profondeur)”

SH.content: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself
SH.linkedContent: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself

SH.content: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event
SH.linkedContent: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event

SH.content: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]
SH.linkedContent: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]

SH.content: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)
SH.linkedContent: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s new philosophers are friends of solitude (singularity), love cutting ties, uncompromising, w/out proximity, w/out presence, w/out resemblance: not a secret society—it’s exactly the classical concept of the secret they rebel against
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s new philosophers are friends of solitude (singularity), love cutting ties, uncompromising, w/out proximity, w/out presence, w/out resemblance: not a secret society—it’s exactly the classical concept of the secret they rebel against

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s counterculture of knowing-how-to-keep-silent, the responsibility of silence, friendship preserved by silence (in secret)
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s counterculture of knowing-how-to-keep-silent, the responsibility of silence, friendship preserved by silence (in secret)

POOF.content: partisan in cryptography, in unassignable ‘political’ status of psychoanalysis, in blurred borders btwn privacy/publicity, in cybercrime > politics of friendship should not be distinguishable from a meditation on secrecy
POOF.linkedContent: partisan in cryptography, in unassignable ‘political’ status of psychoanalysis, in blurred borders btwn privacy/publicity, in cybercrime > politics of friendship should not be distinguishable from a meditation on secrecy

POOF.content: via Montaigne, law of secrecy placed above law of city, apolitical drive of friendship divides virtue or reason > double bind: 1) sovereign fraternity of secrecy btwn 2 w/out perjury 2) political secrecy of brotherhood begins w/ the 3rd, opens to perjury
POOF.linkedContent: via Montaigne, law of secrecy placed above law of city, apolitical drive of friendship divides virtue or reason > double bind: 1) sovereign fraternity of secrecy btwn 2 w/out perjury 2) political secrecy of brotherhood begins w/ the 3rd, opens to perjury

POOF.content: for Kant, friendship is rare, the rarity of keeping a secret, a black swan > [Derrida seems to hint that Kant is getting personal here: Kant murmurs a confession]
POOF.linkedContent: for Kant, friendship is rare, the rarity of keeping a secret, a black swan > [Derrida seems to hint that Kant is getting personal here: Kant murmurs a confession]

POOF.content: a few oddities that don’t surprise Kant: 1) no secrets in nature, secrets only there where there’s engagement, promise—and no one has the infinite intelligence to know for certain what the secret is 2) the impossible & necessary arithmetic returns: friendship as n + 1, plus d’un, there’s always one more than the 2 friends, a 3rd, so how can the secret be kept? 3) merely moral friendship is not just ideal, the event of friendship happens, the black swan
POOF.linkedContent: a few oddities that don’t surprise Kant: 1) no secrets in nature, secrets only there where there’s engagement, promise—and no one has the infinite intelligence to know for certain what the secret is 2) the impossible & necessary arithmetic returns: friendship as n + 1, plus d’un, there’s always one more than the 2 friends, a 3rd, so how can the secret be kept? 3) merely moral friendship is not just ideal, the event of friendship happens, the black swan

POOF.content: the 3rd witnesses a law that interrupts vertigo of singularity (a dual narcissism), 3rd opens up & keeps from closing the question of secrecy > Nietzsche: for the hermit, the friend is always 3rd person (keeps the other 2 [w/in oneself] from sinking to the depths)
POOF.linkedContent: the 3rd witnesses a law that interrupts vertigo of singularity (a dual narcissism), 3rd opens up & keeps from closing the question of secrecy > Nietzsche: for the hermit, the friend is always 3rd person (keeps the other 2 [w/in oneself] from sinking to the depths)

F.content: crypt must always incorporate more than one, plus d’un: cryptophore’s secret must be shared (partagé) w/ a “third,” that’s what makes a secret a secret
F.linkedContent: crypt must always incorporate more than one, plus d’un: cryptophore’s secret must be shared (partagé) w/ a “third,” that’s what makes a secret a secret

F.content: mythic founding event is only possible in secrecy—so it can ‘take place’
F.linkedContent: mythic founding event is only possible in secrecy—so it can ‘take place’

DS.content: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)
DS.linkedContent: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)

DS.content: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin
DS.linkedContent: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin

ROP.content: via Foucault, doctor capitalizes/speculates on secret, capital of secret, the secrecy effect, technique of the secret, secret of secret: make one suppose knowledge and believe in the secret, attributes of Evil Genius attributed to doctor, he uses unreason, uses fiction/simulacrum
ROP.linkedContent: via Foucault, doctor capitalizes/speculates on secret, capital of secret, the secrecy effect, technique of the secret, secret of secret: make one suppose knowledge and believe in the secret, attributes of Evil Genius attributed to doctor, he uses unreason, uses fiction/simulacrum

FS.content: to see structure more clearly, solicit it, threaten its supports: concentrate on its [structuralism’s] keystone (la clef de voûte) (possibility & fragility of its existence) > the secret place where structure is neither construction nor ruin but lability
FS.linkedContent: to see structure more clearly, solicit it, threaten its supports: concentrate on its [structuralism’s] keystone (la clef de voûte) (possibility & fragility of its existence) > the secret place where structure is neither construction nor ruin but lability

SW.linkedContent: tallith as intimate secretion [see SERICULTURE], opened, given birth by divine word preceding it, & also separate, dissociated, dissolves bond, holds to secret

SW.content: silkworm secretes absolutely, a thing which would never be an object it would stand against
SW.linkedContent: silkworm secretes absolutely, a thing which would never be an object it would stand against

DPi.content: secret: what if I deconstructed the “seminar” by telling you I won’t tell you the truth even if I know it? > blow to deconstructed pieces the idea of the seminar that’s obliged by oath to speak all possible truth
DPi.linkedContent: secret: what if I deconstructed the “seminar” by telling you I won’t tell you the truth even if I know it? > blow to deconstructed pieces the idea of the seminar that’s obliged by oath to speak all possible truth

RGE.linkedContent: sovereignty, the putting at stake, the space of writing, absolute in night of secret: “continuum of sovereign communication has as its milieu this night of secret difference” > one would understand nothing if one thought there’s a contradiction btwn these 2 requisites

Gii.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Gedicht is silent source of written and spoken poems (Dichtungen)

Gii.content: Ein Geschlecht shelters Grundton (fundamental note), from which Gedicht of poets keeps the secret (Geheimnis) silent (schweigt)
Gii.linkedContent: Ein Geschlecht shelters Grundton (fundamental note), from which Gedicht of poets keeps the secret (Geheimnis) silent (schweigt)

Gii.linkedContent: the “situation (Erörterung)” of Gedicht needs recourse to idiom of Geschlecht (Geschlecht of idiom)? how to think Gedicht’s belonging, appropriation to a language, to a Geschlecht

REST.linkedContent: obviously secret: cipher remains secret because not concealed > encrypted in the ether of obviousness & truth [re: correspondence btwn Heidegger/Shapiro] [cf. p. 283 “invisible ether of this trivial self-evidence”: the shoes in the work are out of work because they are painted]

REST.linkedContent: when something is entrusted to the purveyor of truth, it is a secret for no one

REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Geborgenheit associates hidden, crypted secret w/ being-in-safety: what one must hold in reserve, conceal, to live > tightening of originary ring > effect of Verlässlichkeit

REST.linkedContent: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret

DST.linkedContent: inevitable impurity of secret of idiom

DST.linkedContent: secret: the w/out relation (sans-rapport) [compare to Lacan’s no sexual relation], the separation, the interruption

HLP.linkedContent: for Koyré, any secret threatens res publica: politeia as absolute phenomenality, thus required transparency/illumination of public space

HLP.content: lead to totalitarianism w/ democratic face: [everything must be illuminated]
HLP.linkedContent: lead to totalitarianism w/ democratic face: [everything must be illuminated]

HLP.content: Hitler used “old Machiavellian technique”: tell truth knowing the uninitiated will not take him seriously, “conspiracy in broad daylight,” “society w/ a secret”
HLP.linkedContent: Hitler used “old Machiavellian technique”: tell truth knowing the uninitiated will not take him seriously, “conspiracy in broad daylight,” “society w/ a secret”

HLP.linkedContent: Marrano: right to secrecy as right to resistance beyond order of political (or theologico-political in general)

PSSS.content: secrecy delimits political authority [re: institution of psychoanalysis]

C.content: family resemblance removes none [of the 127 coffins] from itself, from the absolute secret, from definitive detachment that isolates/ab-solves outside series
C.linkedContent: family resemblance removes none [of the 127 coffins] from itself, from the absolute secret, from definitive detachment that isolates/ab-solves outside series

C.content: little princeps coffin has no relationship w/ family > and yet, in secret, in an immemorial past that was never present, he engendered this family
C.linkedContent: little princeps coffin has no relationship w/ family > and yet, in secret, in an immemorial past that was never present, he engendered this family

C.content: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition
C.linkedContent: excess zeal, the little one (paradigm) built like a crypt [Lacan’s objet a?], jealously keeps its secret at moment of greatest exhibition

C.content: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket
C.linkedContent: hermetically closed (portable temples called hermes): mute beneath its altuglassed transparency, seduces, attracts the dead man, makes him come back and more: fors in that casket

AD.linkedContent: Levinas: welcoming, “understanding w/out words,” “expression in secret,” “feminine alterity”

CF.content: a politics that would respect the secret (that which exceeds the political or is no longer in juridical domain): democracy to come
CF.linkedContent: a politics that would respect the secret (that which exceeds the political or is no longer in juridical domain): democracy to come

CIN.content: “se donnant à elle-même, se donnant comme son propre nom, l’art consumé du secret: de l’exhibition savoir se garder” [to give to itself, give to itself as its proper name, consummate art of secret: the exhibition of knowing how to guard oneself] [compare to God’s fiery consumption]
CIN.linkedContent: “se donnant à elle-même, se donnant comme son propre nom, l’art consumé du secret: de l’exhibition savoir se garder” [to give to itself, give to itself as its proper name, consummate art of secret: the exhibition of knowing how to guard oneself] [compare to God’s fiery consumption]

CIN.content: nothing will have taken place but the place, there are cinders, there is place (il y a lieu) > this untranslatable, like a hidden proper name, carries everything away toward prescribed limit, recognition, debt, obligation > place (proper name) for giving, rendering, celebrating, loving, friendship, dissemination…
CIN.linkedContent: nothing will have taken place but the place, there are cinders, there is place (il y a lieu) > this untranslatable, like a hidden proper name, carries everything away toward prescribed limit, recognition, debt, obligation > place (proper name) for giving, rendering, celebrating, loving, friendship, dissemination…

CIN.content: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”
CIN.linkedContent: perhaps he [Derrida] (or she [la cinder]) knew what he set on fire, what he praised in the secret of the sentence “il y a là cendre,” but he may discover more in its unconscious, and he will die > then the phrase w/ its chance of surviving him will be more cinder than ever, and less—w/out anyone to say “I”

CIN.content: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]
CIN.linkedContent: [Derrida on his own “counterfeiter’s forgery,” on his ability to lie, or not be certain what he knows, but what does he know or lie about w/ such indeterminate phrases?]

CIN.content: “language poisons for us the most secret of our secrets…one must even sacrifice one’s own sacrifice to it”
CIN.linkedContent: “language poisons for us the most secret of our secrets…one must even sacrifice one’s own sacrifice to it”

BSi.content: Celan’s 2 secrets of the poem: 1) signature, genesis of poem 2) the present that doesn’t present itself
BSi.linkedContent: Celan’s 2 secrets of the poem: 1) signature, genesis of poem 2) the present that doesn’t present itself

BSi.content: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
BSi.linkedContent: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present

OG.content: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech
OG.linkedContent: the horizontality of spacing, hollow of differance, discontinuity and discreteness (does not oppose it(self) like surface to depth), a hinge (brisure) marking impossibility of full speech

OG.content: complex layering of 3 violences re: proper names: 1) expropriation, repetition, déjà dédoublée, arche-writing, to give name it’s forbidden to pronounce, to name what’s never present, the unique [fire in CIN, Glas] 2) secret, protective, reparatory, “moral,” conceal names 3) the scene of proper names, reassuring seal of self-identity, refers to #1 and #2, empirical consciousness, common concept of violence, revealing name by effraction: evil, war, rape (system of moral law & transgression) [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]
OG.linkedContent: complex layering of 3 violences re: proper names: 1) expropriation, repetition, déjà dédoublée, arche-writing, to give name it’s forbidden to pronounce, to name what’s never present, the unique [fire in CIN, Glas] 2) secret, protective, reparatory, “moral,” conceal names 3) the scene of proper names, reassuring seal of self-identity, refers to #1 and #2, empirical consciousness, common concept of violence, revealing name by effraction: evil, war, rape (system of moral law & transgression) [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]

ATAP.content: agogic function of leader, il Duce, Führer, mystagogue, jealously protects unveiling of secret: elite beings, distinguished subjects [Donald Trump]
ATAP.linkedContent: agogic function of leader, il Duce, Führer, mystagogue, jealously protects unveiling of secret: elite beings, distinguished subjects [Donald Trump]

ATAP.content: death, another apocalypse—whoever speaks apocalyptically: truth of truth, truth as end, Last Judgment, seduces w/ unbearable pure differential vibration (the 1st)
ATAP.linkedContent: death, another apocalypse—whoever speaks apocalyptically: truth of truth, truth as end, Last Judgment, seduces w/ unbearable pure differential vibration (the 1st)

ATAP.content: this death sentence, cet arrêt de mort, can only judge us, those who don’t know this secret are already dead, so… let’s make a sect, sex, gender, race (Geschlecht) by ourselves [Babel scene] > we are the only ones in the world
ATAP.linkedContent: this death sentence, cet arrêt de mort, can only judge us, those who don’t know this secret are already dead, so… let’s make a sect, sex, gender, race (Geschlecht) by ourselves [Babel scene] > we are the only ones in the world

CIR.content: secret I’m jealously seeking as last word of my jealousy, continually turning around it w/out knowing secret of my suffering
CIR.linkedContent: secret I’m jealously seeking as last word of my jealousy, continually turning around it w/out knowing secret of my suffering

CIR.content: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked; Derrida’s talking about conscious secrets: no one has yet said anything about the secret as known
CIR.linkedContent: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked; Derrida’s talking about conscious secrets: no one has yet said anything about the secret as known

CIR.content: held to secrecy by those who know your secret, share w/ you the open secret, just as useless to make it know, blank sacrifices, son not bearing his name [Pierre]
CIR.linkedContent: held to secrecy by those who know your secret, share w/ you the open secret, just as useless to make it know, blank sacrifices, son not bearing his name [Pierre]

CIR.content: no one will know from what secret I’m writing, that I say so changes nothing
CIR.linkedContent: no one will know from what secret I’m writing, that I say so changes nothing

CIR.content: phantom or prophet charged w/ mission, heavily charged w/ secret unknown to him
CIR.linkedContent: phantom or prophet charged w/ mission, heavily charged w/ secret unknown to him

CIR.content: all my tears (of love), prayers, bleeding like overflow of murders I carry w/in myself, knowing not whether I committed them or not, against the other or against me
CIR.linkedContent: all my tears (of love), prayers, bleeding like overflow of murders I carry w/in myself, knowing not whether I committed them or not, against the other or against me

CIR.content: spare the sister, she, the password, our lifelong secret, inside of the ring
CIR.linkedContent: spare the sister, she, the password, our lifelong secret, inside of the ring

EU.content: Descartes distrusts “arcanum” (secret) in Hardy, but Derrida sees this as trading one utopia for another > Descartes’ will be a philosophical romance [a philosophy w/out secret as a deeper secret?]
EU.linkedContent: Descartes distrusts “arcanum” (secret) in Hardy, but Derrida sees this as trading one utopia for another > Descartes’ will be a philosophical romance [a philosophy w/out secret as a deeper secret?]

EU.content: Descartes’ counter-proposal [to Hardy]: arcanum of “true science” > method, artificial intelligence, translating machine (could be taught in very little time): universality as principle of order, as path, passage, odos
EU.linkedContent: Descartes’ counter-proposal [to Hardy]: arcanum of “true science” > method, artificial intelligence, translating machine (could be taught in very little time): universality as principle of order, as path, passage, odos

EU.content: most post-Kantians (incl. Nietzsche [?]) claim to have already reached the inaccessible: to think finitude, you have already thought the infinite (this becomes definition of thinking)
EU.linkedContent: most post-Kantians (incl. Nietzsche [?]) claim to have already reached the inaccessible: to think finitude, you have already thought the infinite (this becomes definition of thinking)

EU.content: post-Kantians accuse Kant of founding “criticism” in denegation, more responsible to found thought in inaccessible
EU.linkedContent: post-Kantians accuse Kant of founding “criticism” in denegation, more responsible to found thought in inaccessible

SPEC.content: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s fort/da] law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s fort/da] law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary

SPEC.content: document is ciphered, will remain secret if author dies before “his own (les siens),” all “his own” will be those who believe they can decipher the will (testament) of this code
SPEC.linkedContent: document is ciphered, will remain secret if author dies before “his own (les siens),” all “his own” will be those who believe they can decipher the will (testament) of this code

SPEC.content: Freud’s  metaphor of the “vesicle,” protoplasmic bulb, amortizes excitations from outside world [and inside], protects, can be transferred to every corpus [i.e. text]: transference from one legatee to the other, like the simulacrum of secret

SPEC.content: whatever becomes too familiar can be suspected of jealously guarding a secret [re: Aristophanes’ speech in Symposium]
